study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of two doses of black maca extract on learning, memory, and related biochemical markers (MDA, Ache, MAO) in ovariectomized mice.
results_summary: Black maca improved memory impairment in ovariectomized mice, increased step-down latency, reduced MDA and Ache levels, but did not affect MAO levels. The effects were attributed to antioxidant and Ache inhibitory properties.
population_specificity: Ovariectomized female mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of red maca (RM) on testosterone-induced prostate hyperplasia in adult mice.
results_summary: RM reduced prostate weight and prevented increases in acinar and stromal areas induced by testosterone, showing anti-hyperplastic effects comparable to Finasteride. The reduction in prostate size was 1.59 times, and stromal area reduction was 1.42 times.
population_specificity: Adult mice with testosterone-induced prostate hyperplasia.

study_goal: To evaluate the effect of different fractions of Black Maca hydroalcoholic extract on spermatogenesis in male rats.
results_summary: The ethyl acetate fraction of Black Maca significantly increased daily sperm production and epididymal sperm count compared to other fractions and the control group, while the sperm count in the vas deferens varied across different fractions. The study suggests that the ethyl acetate fraction contains compounds beneficial for sperm production, possibly due to antioxidant effects.
population_specificity: Adult male Holtzman strain rats (3 months old).

study_goal: To determine the acute and chronic effects of Maca on male sexual behavior and examine its impact on anxiety in rats.
results_summary: Maca showed a small increase in ejaculation latency and postejaculatory interval after acute and short-term use but no effect after 21 days. Chronic administration did not increase anxiety or locomotion.
population_specificity: Male rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of a freeze-dried aqueous extract of Red Maca on testosterone-induced benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) in rats.
results_summary: Red Maca reduced prostate weight in a dose-dependent manner, outperforming Finasteride, without affecting serum testosterone levels or seminal vesicles weight. The presence of benzyl glucosinolate (Glucotropaeolin) was confirmed via HPLC.
population_specificity: Adult Holtzman strain rats with experimentally induced BPH.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of pre-Gelatinized Organic Maca (Maca-GO) on hormonal balance, menopausal symptoms, and bone density markers in early-postmenopausal women.
results_summary: Maca-GO significantly increased estrogen levels, reduced FSH and other hormones, improved bone density markers, and alleviated menopausal symptoms such as hot flushes and night sweating. It also influenced lipid profiles and key minerals positively.
population_specificity: Early-postmenopausal Caucasian women (34 participants).
effective_dosage: 2 g/day (two 500 mg capsules twice daily with meals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether Black maca has early effects on spermatogenesis in male rats during a 12-day spermatogenic cycle.
results_summary: Black maca increased epididymal sperm count after 1 day of treatment, vas deferens sperm count by day 3, and daily sperm production by day 7, without affecting testicular testosterone levels.
population_specificity: Male rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Pre-Gelatinized Organic Maca (Maca-GO) on hormonal levels, lipid profiles, and menopausal symptoms in early-postmenopausal women.
results_summary: Maca-GO significantly increased estradiol (E2) levels, reduced follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH), improved HDL cholesterol, and alleviated menopausal symptoms, particularly hot flushes and night sweating, as measured by Kupperman's Index (KMI).
population_specificity: Caucasian early-postmenopausal women (age >49 years) with FSH >30 IU/ml and E2 <40 pg/ml.
effective_dosage: 2 g/day (two 500 mg capsules twice daily with meals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Maca (Lepidium meyenii) has anti-echinococcal activity and if it enhances the efficacy of albendazole (ABZ) in treating alveolar echinococcosis (AE).
results_summary: Maca alone showed no direct anti-parasitic activity but may have immunomodulatory effects. Combined with ABZ, it reduced parasite burden in mice, though it inhibited ABZ's activity in vitro. The patient case suggested a potential curative effect.
population_specificity: A 56-year-old male AE patient and experimentally infected mice.
study_duration: 42 months (patient), duration in mice not specified
interactions: Maca did not alter ABZ plasma levels but inhibited its activity in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Yellow, Red, and Black Maca on cognitive function and depression in ovariectomized mice.
results_summary: Black Maca showed the most beneficial effects on latent learning, while all three varieties reduced immobility time in the forced swimming test (indicating antidepressant activity) and increased uterine weight in OVX mice.
population_specificity: Ovariectomized mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Maca could mitigate lead acetate-induced spermatogenic disruption and improve reproductive parameters in rats.
results_summary: Maca administration restored the lengths of seminiferous epithelium stages VIII and IX-XI, improved daily sperm production, and counteracted lead acetate-induced reductions in sperm count and testosterone levels. It showed protective effects against spermatogenic disruption, particularly at lower lead acetate doses (8 and 16 mg/kg).
population_specificity: Male rats exposed to lead acetate.
effective_dosage: Not specified (oral administration from day 18 to day 35).
study_duration: 18 days (from day 18 to day 35 of the 35-day lead acetate exposure).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether different ecotypes of Maca (Red, Yellow, and Black) differentially affect spermatogenesis in adult rats after short-term (7 days) and long-term (42 days) treatment.
results_summary: Black Maca increased daily sperm production (DSP) and epididymal sperm motility after long-term treatment, while Red Maca reduced prostate weight without affecting sperm parameters. Yellow Maca showed limited effects on spermatogenesis.
population_specificity: Adult rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of Pre-Gelatinized Organic Maca (Maca-GO) on hormonal balance and symptom alleviation in perimenopausal women.
results_summary: Maca-GO significantly alleviated menopausal discomfort (74%-87% of participants), increased E2, FSH, progesterone, and ACTH levels, and reduced blood pressure, body weight, triglycerides, and cholesterol. A placebo effect was noted initially.
population_specificity: Perimenopausal women aged 41-50 with E2 >40pg/ml and FSH <30IU/ml (n=20).
study_duration: 4 months (2 months Maca-GO, 2 months placebo, with crossover).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the chronic effects of different Maca varieties (Red, Yellow, Black) on sperm production and count in male rats, as well as assess potential toxicity.
results_summary: Yellow and Black Maca improved epididymal sperm count, while all three varieties increased sperm count in the vas deferens without affecting daily sperm production. No toxic effects were observed in liver or spleen histology.
population_specificity: Male rats
effective_dosage: Aqueous extract equivalent to 1 g hypocotyl per kg body weight daily

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Maca on fertility parameters in female mice, including reproductive indexes, implantation sites, and uterine weight in ovariectomized mice.
results_summary: Maca increased litter size and uterine weight in ovariectomized mice but did not affect implantation sites or other reproductive indexes. Vaginal opening day was unaffected by Maca.
population_specificity: Adult female Balb/C mice at reproductive age.
effective_dosage: 1 g/kg body weight of aqueous extract of lyophilized Yellow Maca, administered orally.
study_duration: Treatment was administered before, during, and after gestation for the fertility indexes study; duration specifics for other groups are not detailed.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether Maca (Lepidium peruvianum Chacon) could alleviate menopausal discomfort in early postmenopausal women by influencing hormone levels and reducing symptoms.
results_summary: Maca-GO significantly decreased FSH and increased LH levels, leading to elevated E2 and PG after eight months, which correlated with reduced menopausal discomfort. A notable placebo effect was also observed.
population_specificity: 20 Caucasian healthy early-postmenopausal women (Trial I) and 8 women (Trial II).
effective_dosage: 2g gelatinized Maca root powder daily (two 500mg capsules, twice daily).

study_goal: To determine if Maca can mitigate spermatogenic damage caused by the organophosphate insecticide malathion in mice.
results_summary: Maca significantly increased the length of stage VIII of the seminiferous epithelium on days 7, 14, and 21, and reduced the spermatogenic damage caused by malathion, particularly in stages IX-XII. The study concluded that Maca enhances spermatogenesis recovery after malathion-induced damage.
population_specificity: Mice treated with malathion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether different ecotypes of Maca (Yellow, Black, and Red) could reduce ventral prostate size and affect hormone levels in rats, particularly focusing on Red Maca's potential anti-proliferative effects.
results_summary: Red Maca significantly reduced ventral prostate size in normal and testosterone-treated rats, without affecting serum testosterone or estradiol levels. It also prevented prostate weight increases induced by testosterone enanthate and reduced epithelial height and duct luminal area.
population_specificity: Male rats (normal and testosterone-treated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Maca alcoholic extract on spermatogenesis in male rats.
results_summary: Maca extract increased the length of specific stages of seminiferous epithelium and epididymal sperm count at 48 mg/day, but higher doses (96 mg/day) showed mixed results. Serum testosterone levels remained unaffected.
population_specificity: Male Holtzman rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Maca affects serum reproductive hormone levels in healthy men when administered at doses used for aphrodisiac or fertility-enhancing properties.
results_summary: The study found that Maca had no effect on serum reproductive hormone levels (luteinizing hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, prolactin, 17-alpha hydroxyprogesterone, testosterone, or 17-beta estradiol) compared to placebo, and hormone levels did not change over time.
population_specificity: Healthy men aged 21-56 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify differential gene expression patterns between tamoxifen-sensitive and tamoxifen-resistant human breast cancer models to derive markers for tamoxifen resistance.
results_summary: The study found over 100 transcripts with altered abundance in tamoxifen-resistant tumors, including up-regulation of NNAT and BST2 genes, and confirmed differential expression of four genes (NNAT, BST2, IGFBP5, and BCAS1) via Taqman PCR. These findings provide potential targets for diagnostic or therapeutic approaches in tamoxifen-resistant breast cancer.
population_specificity: Human breast cancer xenograft models (MaCa 3366 and MaCa 3366/TAM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Maca's effect on sexual desire was due to mood changes or serum testosterone levels.
results_summary: Maca improved sexual desire after 8 weeks of treatment, independent of changes in mood (depression/anxiety) or hormone levels (testosterone/oestradiol). No differences in hormone levels were observed between Maca and placebo groups.
population_specificity: Men aged 21-56 years

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Maca could prevent high altitude-induced testicular disturbances in male rats, specifically focusing on spermatogenic disruption.
results_summary: Maca treatment increased epididymal sperm count and the length of stage VIII of the seminiferous epithelium in a dose-dependent manner, while reducing the length of stage I. At high altitude, Maca prevented reductions in sperm count and spermatogenic disruption, maintaining levels similar to those at sea level.
population_specificity: Adult male rats exposed to high altitude (4340 m) or at sea level.
effective_dosage: 666.6 mg/day (highest effective dose), with lower doses (6.6 and 66.6 mg/day) also tested in the dose-response study.
study_duration: 21 days at high altitude, 7 days for the dose-response study at sea level.

study_goal: To determine the effect of oral administration of an aqueous extract from Maca roots on spermatogenesis in adult male rats.
results_summary: Treatment with Maca increased testis and epididymis weights, enhanced the length and frequency of seminiferous tubule stages IX-XIV (where mitosis occurs), and reduced stages I-VI, indicating improved spermatogenesis.
population_specificity: Adult male rats
effective_dosage: 66.7 mg in one mL, twice daily

study_goal: To examine the effects of LmW (Lepidium meyenii Walp., Maca) supplementation on physical performance in animal and human studies and calculate the effect sizes of different interventions.
results_summary: The meta-analysis revealed large effects for all outcomes, indicating that Maca's phytochemical compounds, particularly macamides, enhance physical performance, with greater effects observed at higher doses (dose-response effect).
population_specificity: Animal and human subjects (specific details not provided in the abstract).
effective_dosage: Higher doses showed greater effects (specific amounts not provided in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the cardioprotective effects of magnesium in reducing apoptosis and endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) through hydrogen release in a rat model of isoproterenol-induced heart failure.
results_summary: Magnesium improved cardiac function, reduced myocardial fibrosis and hypertrophy, lowered plasma biomarkers of cardiac injury, and inhibited apoptosis and ERS markers. It also elevated hydrogen levels in blood, plasma, and cardiac tissue, with hydrogen release lasting at least four hours.
population_specificity: ISO-induced heart failure rats and H9C2 cardiomyocyte injury models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the degradation behavior of biodegradable porous magnesium alloy (pMg) scaffolds and their reparative effects on bone defects when combined with low-intensity pulsed ultrasound (LIPUS).
results_summary: LIPUS accelerated pMg scaffold degradation by loosening the degradation layer and enhanced calcium and phosphorus accumulation. The pMg + LIPUS group showed improved bone formation, mineralization, and hardness compared to pMg alone, approaching healthy bone levels by 24 weeks.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats with femoral bone defects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term impact of the PReCePT programme on the uptake of antenatal magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) for preventing cerebral palsy in preterm babies and compare its use in England to Scotland and Wales.
results_summary: MgSO4 administration increased from 65.8% in 2017 to 85.5% in 2022 in England, with the PReCePT programme associated with a 5.8 percentage point improvement in uptake. The programme was cost-effective, with a net monetary benefit of £597,000, and showed greater improvement when including older preterm births (<34 weeks' gestation).
population_specificity: Mothers in preterm labour (<30 weeks' gestation) and their preterm babies admitted to NHS neonatal units in England, Scotland, and Wales.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of a 4-month oral treatment with Maca tablets on seminal analysis and serum hormone levels in adult men.
results_summary: Maca treatment increased seminal volume, sperm count, motile sperm count, and sperm motility without altering serum hormone levels (LH, FSH, PRL, T, E2). The sperm count improvement was not dose-dependent.
population_specificity: Nine adult men aged 24-44 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the utility of Magnesium (Mg) as a dual-function dental implant coating, focusing on its osteogenic and antibacterial properties.
results_summary: The study found that Mg shows promise as a dental implant coating due to its osteoinductive and antimicrobial effects, though the precise mechanisms remain unclear. Challenges such as degradation rate and long-term stability need further research.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on dental implant applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between magnesium depletion score (MDS) and kidney stones (KDS) in gout patients and explore potential mediating mechanisms.
results_summary: The study found a significant positive association between MDS grade and KDS, with higher MDS grades linked to increased kidney stone risk. Magnesium metabolism disruption was identified as a key factor in gout-related kidney injury, particularly in obese, hypertensive, and diabetic patients.
population_specificity: 502 gout patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a magnesium-based micromotor system (Mg-Motor-DOX) could enhance chemotherapy efficacy and reduce glioblastoma recurrence by generating hydrogen gas and improving drug delivery.
results_summary: The Mg-Motor-DOX system generated hydrogen gas in situ, improving doxorubicin penetration and sensitivity, significantly inhibiting glioblastoma recurrence. It also modulated the tumor immune microenvironment, converting "cold" tumors into "hot" tumors.
population_specificity: Glioblastoma (GBM) patients post-subtotal tumor resection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic benefits of Magnesium lithospermate B (Mlb) in preventing AKI-to-CKD progression, focusing on its effects on renal fibrosis and cell cycle regulation.
results_summary: Mlb treatment significantly reduced renal dysfunction, inflammation, apoptosis, and G2/M phase cell cycle stalling in mice, improving renal fibrosis by activating the KLF5/CDK1/Cyclin B1 signaling pathway. These effects were validated in both in vivo and in vitro models.
population_specificity: Mice with unilateral ischemia/reperfusion-induced AKI-to-CKD progression and HK-2 cells with TGF-β-induced fibrosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of a novel PVDF/MgO mixed matrix membrane for removing pollutant dyes from industrial wastewater.
results_summary: The study found that the PVDF/MgO membrane effectively removed Bemacid Turquoise dye under optimized conditions, with the ANN model outperforming the RSM model in predicting filtration efficiency. The highest dye filtration was achieved at specific conditions of concentration, membrane composition, and temperature.
population_specificity: Industrial wastewater treatment applications (not human consumption).
effective_dosage: Membrane composition of 0.6% and 0.51% under different conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether SGLT2 inhibitors (dapagliflozin) could effectively increase serum magnesium levels and reduce hypomagnesemia in kidney transplant recipients, regardless of diabetes status.
results_summary: The study found that SGLT2i therapy significantly increased serum magnesium levels and reduced hypomagnesemia in kidney transplant recipients, independent of diabetes status. Oral magnesium supplementation did not correlate with improved magnesium levels, reinforcing its limited efficacy. Additional benefits included reductions in body weight, blood pressure, and serum urate without compromising graft function.
population_specificity: Kidney transplant recipients (63 participants)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether foliar application of magnesium (Mg) and potassium (K) could improve the phytochemical composition and antioxidant activity of sweet cherries.
results_summary: Mg treatments (especially Mg250 in 2019 and Mg125 in 2020) enhanced the phytochemical composition and antioxidant activity of sweet cherries, while K treatments (mainly K50) reduced these properties. The study showed consistent improvements over three years, with the highest values in 2021.
population_specificity: Sweet cherry trees of the Burlat cultivar.
effective_dosage: Mg250 (2019), Mg125 (2020), and K50 (specific dosages not fully detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium-doped bioactive glass (MgBG) could enhance the delivery and efficacy of small extracellular vesicles (sEVs) in promoting diabetic wound healing.
results_summary: The study found that MgBG significantly improved intracellular uptake of sEVs, enhanced macrophage M2 polarization, reduced inflammation, and promoted angiogenesis and collagen deposition in diabetic wounds. The hydrogel system demonstrated excellent injectability, self-healing, and bioadhesive properties, along with photoresponsive bactericidal activity.
population_specificity: Diabetic wound models (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium could protect against immune stress-induced damage, particularly anaphylactic shock and cardiac myolysis, by modulating calcium-magnesium balance.
results_summary: Magnesium reduced the incidence of cardiac myolysis (40% to 10%) and anaphylactic shock (61% to 35%), attenuated shock severity, and lowered mortality (39% to 19%). Elevated magnesium levels in cell culture also reduced cytosolic calcium spikes post-antigen challenge.
population_specificity: Antigen-sensitized guinea-pigs and rat basophilic leukemia (RBL) cells.
effective_dosage: 15 mg MgCl2 intraperitoneally as a single dose.
study_duration: Single dose administered 1 hour before antigen challenge, with effects observed over 2 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maintaining target serum magnesium levels could influence intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH) expansion in acute ICH patients.
results_summary: Admission serum magnesium levels correlated with ICH expansion, but maintaining target magnesium levels did not significantly reduce ICH volume compared to controls. Magnesium may serve as an indicator for potential therapeutic strategies rather than a direct treatment target.
population_specificity: Acute ICH patients aged 18-80 years, with radiological diagnosis and no surgical intervention.
effective_dosage: Target serum magnesium levels of 2-3 mg/dL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between serum magnesium levels and the risk of symptomatic patent ductus arteriosus in premature infants, as well as its impact on other neonatal morbidities.
results_summary: The study found no significant relationship between serum magnesium levels and symptomatic patent ductus arteriosus or the need for medical/surgical intervention. However, higher magnesium levels (>3 mg/dL) were associated with increased respiratory distress syndrome but lower bronchopulmonary dysplasia.
population_specificity: Premature infants

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) combined with labetalol in improving symptoms and pregnancy outcomes in patients with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP).
results_summary: The study found that the combination of MgSO4 and labetalol significantly improved therapeutic effectiveness, symptom resolution, pregnancy outcomes, and reduced blood pressure and inflammatory markers compared to MgSO4 alone.
population_specificity: 122 patients with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP).

study_goal: To investigate the biocompatibility and osteogenic potential of 3D-printed porous WE43 magnesium alloy scaffolds in treating femoral defects in rabbits.
results_summary: The WE43 magnesium alloy scaffolds showed good biocompatibility and osteogenic properties, with significant new bone formation observed around the scaffolds by 12 weeks. However, initial cytotoxicity tests indicated reduced cell survival at higher extract concentrations after 7 days.
population_specificity: New Zealand white rabbits (in vivo) and bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells from Sprague Dawley rats (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether magnesium sulfate could prevent paclitaxel-induced neuropathic pain by inhibiting the TNF-α-TRAF6-NF-κB axis.
results_summary: Magnesium sulfate at 300 and 150 mg/kg doses reduced TNF-α synthesis and suppressed the TNF-α-TRAF6-NF-κB axis, while lower doses showed mixed effects on miR-146a-5p expression.
population_specificity: Male rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a magnesium (Mg) alloy plate could promote bone formation and be bioabsorbable in a rabbit tibia fracture model, compared to traditional titanium plates.
results_summary: The Mg plate significantly enhanced bone and callus formation compared to titanium, was mostly bioabsorbed after bone union, and showed no biotoxic effects. Exogenous magnesium also increased calcium deposition in osteoblast cultures.
population_specificity: Rabbit tibia fracture model
study_duration: Until bone union was achieved (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Mg2+ on chromosome structure in normal human lymphocytes using GTL-banding and karyotyping.
results_summary: The study found that Mg2+ is essential for maintaining compact chromosome structure in lymphocytes, as chromosomes treated without Mg2+ (XBE) or with a chelator (EDTA) showed less compact, fibrous structures with unclear banding patterns compared to the control (5 mM Mg2+). The average chromosome scores for XBE and EDTA-treated chromosomes were higher (less compact) than the control.
population_specificity: Human lymphocytes (normal cells, not cancer cell lines).
effective_dosage: 5 mM Mg2+ (control), 0 mM Mg2+ (XBE), and 1 mM EDTA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of intravenous magnesium and lidocaine in treating herpes zoster neuritis and postherpetic neuralgia when immediate interventional therapy was not possible.
results_summary: The study found statistically significant reductions in pain scores (NRS) after treatment with intravenous magnesium and lidocaine, with pain decreasing progressively over the treatment period. The combination therapy showed promise for managing pain in these conditions.
population_specificity: 23 patients with herpes zoster neuritis and postherpetic neuralgia who could not receive immediate interventional therapy.
effective_dosage: 1.2 g magnesium and 100 mg lidocaine, administered intravenously for one hour weekly for four weeks (five treatments total).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether prophylactic IV magnesium administration reduces the risk of cisplatin-associated acute kidney injury (CP-AKI) in cancer patients undergoing cisplatin chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that patients who received IV magnesium had a lower risk of CP-AKI or death (2.7%) compared to those who did not (5.3%), with an adjusted odds ratio of 0.80. Results were consistent across sensitivity analyses and secondary outcomes.
population_specificity: Adult cancer patients receiving their first dose of IV cisplatin chemotherapy across five major US cancer centers.
effective_dosage: Median dose of 2 g (IQR: 1-2 g) administered on the first day of cisplatin treatment.
study_duration: Single administration on the first day of cisplatin treatment, with outcomes assessed within 14 days and at 90 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of nickel-iron slag (containing MgO) on the properties of magnesium sodium phosphate cement (MNPC) to address environmental pollution and reduce costs.
results_summary: Adding 30% nickel-iron slag improved MNPC's volume deformation, water resistance, and compressive strength, with the lowest porosity and highest strength observed under both air and water curing conditions. Hydration products showed increased crystalline peaks of MgNaPO4·7H2O over time, indicating enhanced performance.
population_specificity: Industrial waste (nickel-iron slag) and cement materials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of magnesium oxide (MgO) combined with hydraulic binders for stabilizing and solidifying molybdenum-contaminated limestone tunnel sludge.
results_summary: The study found that a mixture of 1 wt% MgO and 3 wt% limestone calcined clay cement (LC3) effectively immobilized molybdenum, keeping release levels below 0.05 mg/L after 24 hours of curing, though the treatment was ineffective at neutral or acidic pH due to brucite dissolution.
population_specificity: Molybdenum-contaminated limestone tunnel sludge.
study_duration: Curing intervals from 6 hours to 90 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess magnesium levels in children and adolescents with T1DM compared to healthy controls and correlate these levels with coagulopathy markers and diabetic microangiopathy.
results_summary: Children and adolescents with T1DM had significantly lower magnesium levels, which were associated with poor glycemic control, coagulopathy, and diabetic microangiopathy. Magnesium supplementation combined with insulin therapy was recommended for better glycemic control and prevention of microangiopathy.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM) and healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the SGLT2 inhibitor empagliflozin could mitigate cisplatin-induced hypomagnesemia by targeting magnesium reabsorption in the kidney's thick ascending limb (TAL) and distal convoluted tubule (DCT).
results_summary: Empagliflozin restored serum magnesium levels and reduced fractional excretion of magnesium in cisplatin-treated rats by reversing NKCC2 inhibition and claudin-16 downregulation in the TAL, while normalizing NCC function and TRPM6 expression in the DCT.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the risks of hypermagnesemia from magnesium oxide use in patients with gastrointestinal obstruction or renal dysfunction.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium oxide accumulation due to obstructive ileus and renal impairment led to severe hypermagnesemia, requiring hemodiafiltration. Early measurement of ionized magnesium facilitated prompt intervention.
population_specificity: A 60-year-old man with obstructive ileus due to sigmoid colon cancer and impaired renal function.
effective_dosage: 2000 mg/day magnesium oxide and 34 g magnesium citrate preoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of biodegradable high purity magnesium (Mg) screws versus conventional titanium alloy plates and screws in treating ankle fractures.
results_summary: The study found that biodegradable high purity Mg screws provided sufficient mechanical strength, degraded gradually without complications, and resulted in satisfactory postoperative functional recovery with no reported adverse events. Both groups showed good fracture alignment and no infections, fixation failures, or malunions.
population_specificity: Patients with ankle fractures treated at Affiliated Zhongshan Hospital of Dalian University (24 patients, 12 per group).
study_duration: Follow-up period not explicitly stated, but patients were treated between January 2020 and January 2021.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of magnesium hexacyanoferrate (MgHCF) in mitigating sepsis-associated encephalopathy (SAE) by targeting oxidative stress, neuroinflammation, and disruptions in copper/iron homeostasis.
results_summary: MgHCF effectively scavenged reactive oxygen species (ROS), chelated excess copper and iron, attenuated microglia activation, and protected neuronal cells from oxidative damage and cytotoxicity. It also alleviated cognitive impairment in SAE mice by reducing copper/iron-responsive histone methylation and neuronal cuproptosis.
population_specificity: SAE mice (animal model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a sandwich-like barrier membrane using passivated magnesium mesh as a skeleton to improve mechanical properties and support effects for guided bone regeneration.
results_summary: The barrier membrane demonstrated improved mechanical properties, good antibacterial performance, biocompatibility, anti-inflammatory activity, and promoted osteogenic differentiation of MC3T3-E1 cells.
population_specificity: In vitro study (MC3T3-E1 cells) and implied clinical application for alveolar bone defects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of in situ and ex situ magnesium doping on the electrochemical performance of Li-rich cathode materials.
results_summary: In situ Mg doping improved high-rate performance, while ex situ doping enhanced specific capacity, indicating that bulk structure modification (in situ) is more effective than surface modification (ex situ) for Li-rich cathodes.
population_specificity: Li-rich cathode materials (not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of urine alkalinization using potassium magnesium citrate, among other compounds, for dissolving uric acid stones and treating various urological conditions.
results_summary: Alkalinization with potassium magnesium citrate and other compounds effectively dissolved uric acid stones in multiple cases, achieving complete dissolution in 12 cases and partial or near-complete dissolution in 6 others. The treatment was also used successfully in specific clinical conditions and for preventing stent encrustation.
population_specificity: Patients with uric acid stones (ages 46-91, M/F ratio 7/11), including cases of bilateral, staghorn, unilateral renal stones, and ureteral stones, some with diabetes, obesity, or hyperuricemia.
interactions: Allopurinol was co-administered in 4 cases; bicarbonate was used intravenously and orally in one case.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the mechanical and osteointegration capabilities of a hydrothermally coated Mg-based alloy (Mg AZ31+SPF+HT) and its effects on human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSCs).
results_summary: The study found that Mg AZ31+SPF+HT extracts were biocompatible, showed no toxic effects on cell viability or proliferation, and modulated osteogenic gene expression and mineralization in hMSCs, suggesting potential for bone tissue engineering.
population_specificity: Human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSCs) cultured in basal and osteogenic medium.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nonprescription magnesium supplements reduce the risk of heart failure and major adverse cardiac events in patients with diabetes.
results_summary: Magnesium supplement use was associated with a lower risk of incident heart failure (HR 0.94) and major adverse cardiac events (HR 0.94) in diabetic patients. The findings suggest a modest but statistically significant protective effect.
population_specificity: Veterans aged ≥40 years with diabetes, without prior heart failure or magnesium use, receiving care in the US veterans-health system.
study_duration: Mean duration of 3.5±3.1 years (interquartile range, 1.1-5.1 years)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a magnesium oxide nanoparticle (MgONP)-incorporated chitosan membrane to improve bone regeneration and overcome limitations of existing guided tissue regeneration (GTR) membranes.
results_summary: The MgONP-incorporated membrane showed uniform porosity, slower degradation than control collagen membranes, and favorable outcomes in structural and chemical analyses (SEM, EDAX, FTIR).
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: 0.3 ml of 0.2 M 1% acetic acid with 2% chitosan (0.588 g and 0.576 g concentrations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the anti-osteosarcoma effects and mechanisms of Magnesium (Mg), particularly its ability to inhibit tumor growth and metastasis while promoting osteogenesis.
results_summary: Mg significantly reduced proliferation, migration, and invasion of osteosarcoma cells in vitro and inhibited tumor growth and lung metastasis in vivo. It downregulated the Wnt-pathway by increasing APC, Axin2, and GSK3β while decreasing β-catenin, demonstrating anti-tumor effects at a concentration of 240 mg/L.
population_specificity: Osteosarcoma cells (UMR106, 143B, K7M2) and xenograft models.
effective_dosage: 240 mg/L (from Mg metal extract or MgCl2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether bioactive magnesium (Mg) and silicon (Si) ions delivered via magnesium silicate (MgSiO3) scaffolds could enhance muscle satellite cell (MuSC) proliferation, differentiation, and muscle regeneration in a volumetric muscle loss (VML) model.
results_summary: The study found that Mg and Si ions synergistically promoted MuSC proliferation and differentiation, activated the Notch1-Hes1 pathway, and improved muscle fiber regeneration and neovascularization while reducing fibrosis in a VML mouse model. The MS/PLLA composite scaffold effectively restored muscle function.
population_specificity: VML mouse model (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a composite hydrogel platform (SUMg) containing magnesium particles (MPs) for bone regeneration and antitumor effects in oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) treatment.
results_summary: SUMg demonstrated high cytocompatibility, promoted cell viability, proliferation, spreading, and osteogenesis, with SU10 Mg showing the most significant effect. In vivo, SU10 Mg promoted bone regeneration and, under near-infrared irradiation, produced reactive oxygen species to inhibit tumor growth.
population_specificity: Oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) with jawbone involvement.
effective_dosage: Not specified (SU10 Mg was the most effective formulation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and analyze the application, deficiencies, and improvement strategies of magnesium-based bone implants in orthopedic science.
results_summary: The study highlights magnesium's unique advantages in promoting bone repair but notes rapid degradation as a key drawback. Advanced improvement schemes and application strategies for magnesium-modified bone implants were discussed, along with the latest research on its role in bone defect microenvironments.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on orthopedic implants and bone defects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a MgO nanoparticle-incorporated hydrogel scaffold (P-G-C-MgO2) could effectively mimic natural trabecular bone and enhance bone regeneration in critical-sized defects.
results_summary: The scaffold closely mimicked trabecular bone structure, demonstrated mechanical stability, released bioactive components (Mg2+, collagen, gelatin), facilitated cell recruitment and osteogenic differentiation, and significantly enhanced new bone regeneration in a femoral defect model.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely preclinical, animal model—distal femoral bone defect).
effective_dosage: Not specified (MgO nanoparticle concentration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the biomechanical effectiveness of LCP alone versus LCP-MAS fixation for treating proximal humerus fractures with medial column instability.
results_summary: The LCP-MAS fixation showed significantly greater construct stiffness (3.50 to 7.30 times under normal bone conditions, 2.60 to 4.90 times under osteoporotic conditions), reduced maximum von Mises stress on implants by 70%-80%, and minimized fracture displacement compared to LCP alone.
population_specificity: Patients with complex proximal humerus fractures (PHFs) and medial column instability.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biodegradability and biocompatibility of MgxCA composite implants made by the extrusion technique in Sprague Dawley rats.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in implant weight or gas production post-sacrifice in MgxCA composites, and histopathological examination revealed no significant inflammatory responses, indicating biocompatibility and nontoxic properties.
population_specificity: Sprague Dawley rats
effective_dosage: Mg0CA, Mg5CA, Mg10CA, Mg15CA (specific amounts not detailed)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and safety of intravenous magnesium sulfate (IVMg) in children with severe acute asthma to inform a larger multicenter trial.
results_summary: The study found that IVMg was delivered within 90 minutes to 65.4% of participants, with hypotension rates similar to placebo (6.5% vs. 11.1%). Hospitalization occurred in 73.1% of participants, but enrollment was lower than expected.
population_specificity: Children aged 2-17 years with severe acute asthma treated in emergency departments.
effective_dosage: Low-dose IVMg (50 mg/kg, max 2 g) or high-dose IVMg (75 mg/kg, max 3 g).
study_duration: Single administration during emergency department visit.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how magnesium nutrition affects the biosynthesis of EGCG in tea plants and identify key regulatory genes and transcription factors involved.
results_summary: The study found that low magnesium concentrations increased EGCG content in tea shoots, while high concentrations altered related metabolites in the EGCG synthesis pathway. Key structural genes and transcription factors (MYB 44 and WRKY 17) were identified as regulators of EGCG biosynthesis under magnesium treatment.
population_specificity: Tea plant shoots ('Huangdan' variety)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the difference in short- and long-term neonatal outcomes comparing a small dose (4 g) of magnesium sulphate versus no treatment in preterm infants.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium sulphate reduced severe intraventricular hemorrhage, neonatal mortality, and long-term neurological impairments like cerebral palsy, though some short-term outcomes like intubation rates did not show statistically significant differences.
population_specificity: Pregnant women at risk of preterm delivery and their neonates.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a clinical guideline for detecting and treating magnesium deficiency among healthcare providers in ambulatory care settings.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant increase in magnesium knowledge among healthcare providers after the intervention, with a nonsignificant increase in clinical practice application. Follow-up surveys indicated that providers were likely to incorporate magnesium assessment and treatment tools in future practice.
population_specificity: Healthcare providers (HCPs) in ambulatory care settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the influence of underlying plaque characteristics on in-scaffold late lumen loss (LLL) in patients treated with a third-generation resorbable magnesium scaffold (RMS) up to 12 months.
results_summary: The study found no significant correlation between underlying plaque characteristics (fibrous, calcific, or lipidic lesions) and in-scaffold LLL at 6- or 12-month follow-up. Edge dissection and strut malapposition also had no significant impact on LLL, suggesting better device performance regardless of plaque characteristics.
population_specificity: Patients enrolled in the BIOMAG-I trial who underwent OCT imaging before and after the index procedure (84 patients, 84 lesions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how different heat treatments (as-cast, T4, T6) of AZ91 magnesium alloys affect the formation and corrosion resistance of Layered Double Hydroxide (LDH) coatings.
results_summary: The study found that T6 and T4 alloys, with refined microstructures, formed uniform and compact LDH coatings, enhancing corrosion resistance. In contrast, as-cast AZ91 initially promoted LDH growth but later compromised coating integrity due to large β-phases.
population_specificity: AZ91 magnesium alloys (as-cast, T4, T6 treated)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate magnesium's potential as a carrier for ocular drug delivery systems, focusing on its biocompatibility and the stability of bevacizumab in the presence of magnesium corrosion products.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium corrosion products had no significant impact on bevacizumab stability (changes ≤10%) and showed minimal cytotoxicity (metabolic activity >80% across cell lines), with no adverse effects on cell viability, proliferation, or morphology for up to 72 hours.
population_specificity: In vitro cell lines (murine fibroblasts, rat retinal Müller cells, human retinal pigment epithelial cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the growth-promoting and genotoxic effects of MgZnAl2O4 nanoparticles on barley, focusing on their safety and efficacy at varying concentrations.
results_summary: Low concentrations (<200 mg L-1) of MgZnAl2O4 NPs enhanced barley growth, increasing germination rate, root and leaf growth, and photosynthetic pigments, while high concentrations (100-400 mg L-1) showed phytotoxic and genotoxic effects.
population_specificity: Barley (Hordeum vulgare L.) seedlings
effective_dosage: 0, 50, 100, 200, and 400 mg L-1 in hydroponic solution

study_goal: The researchers aimed to improve the corrosion resistance and biocompatibility of magnesium alloys for bone repair surgeries by developing a novel SF/nHAp composite coating.
results_summary: The SF/nHAp coating significantly enhanced corrosion resistance, reduced hydrogen evolution, promoted tissue regeneration, and minimized post-implant inflammation, suggesting improved biocompatibility and in vivo performance of magnesium alloys.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vivo subcutaneous implantation model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a safe and simple method of providing magnesium to Moringa plants to enhance their nutritional properties for human consumption.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium oxide nanoparticles (MgO-NPs) improved plant growth metrics such as leaf count, leaf area, fresh weight, and dry matter content, indicating enhanced vegetation and chemical properties.
population_specificity: Moringa plants (medicinal plants used for human nutrition).
effective_dosage: Different doses were tested, but the optimal concentration was not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium supplementation could effectively reduce systolic and diastolic blood pressure and pulse rate in hypertensive individuals.
results_summary: Magnesium significantly reduced diastolic blood pressure but had no significant effect on systolic blood pressure or pulse rate. The effect on diastolic blood pressure was modest but statistically significant.
population_specificity: Hypertensive individuals (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a strontium-doped octacalcium phosphate-coated magnesium alloy scaffold for bone defect repair by assessing its degradation rate, biocompatibility, and osteogenic properties.
results_summary: The study found that the SrOCP-coated magnesium alloy scaffold exhibited improved biocompatibility, reduced degradation rate, enhanced osteogenic differentiation, and stronger vascularization and bone regeneration capabilities compared to uncoated scaffolds. The TPMS structure also promoted vascular ingrowth and new bone formation.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo study, likely preclinical models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a magnesium‑phosphorus gel composite (MPNOv) in promoting bone regeneration, preventing tumor recurrence, and resisting infection in bone tumor therapy.
results_summary: MPNOv demonstrated significant pro-osteogenic effects, effectively ablated tumor cells, and eradicated bacteria under NIR irradiation in vitro and in vivo, while also fostering bone generation and preventing infection.
population_specificity: Bone tumor patients (in vitro and in vivo models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a conductive scaffold with sustained release of magnesium (Mg2+) and gallic acid (GA) could enhance bone regeneration by promoting angiogenesis and osteogenesis.
results_summary: The MOF-integrated conductive scaffold demonstrated sustained release of Mg2+ and GA, significantly enhancing new bone formation in a rat calvarial defect model compared to control groups. The synergistic effects of Mg2+ and GA modulated biological responses, improving bone repair outcomes.
population_specificity: Rat calvarial defect model (animal study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the evidence linking magnesium to migraine, including its role in pathogenesis and its utility in prevention and treatment.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium supplementation is effective in alleviating migraine both acutely and chronically, with mechanisms involving cortical depression, vascular changes, oxidative stress, and neurotransmitter release.
population_specificity: Individuals with migraine, including children, adolescents, and adults.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective effects of perioperative intravenous magnesium sulfate on brain damage in patients undergoing supratentorial neurosurgery.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in the primary outcome (serum S100B-protein levels), but magnesium-treated patients showed reduced surgical cavity volume, less gliosis/edema, and better neuropsychological test scores at six months. No relevant adverse effects were reported in the magnesium group.
population_specificity: Fifty adult patients undergoing supratentorial neurosurgery.
effective_dosage: 4 g bolus in 100 mL saline over 20 min, followed by 20 g in 1000 mL saline over 24 h.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the biological mechanisms, clinical applications, and challenges of magnesium in osteoporotic fracture repair, focusing on its role in bone regeneration and microenvironment modulation.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium promotes osteoblast proliferation and differentiation, inhibits osteoclast activity, and modulates the bone microenvironment, making it a promising material for fracture healing. Optimization strategies, such as integration into bone scaffolds and synergistic effects with other metals, were also highlighted.
population_specificity: Osteoporotic fracture patients (general aging population context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of magnesium-modified fly ash (Mg@FA) as an adsorbent for methylene blue dye in wastewater treatment.
results_summary: Mg@FA demonstrated high adsorption efficiency (95.61-98.10%) for methylene blue under optimal conditions (1.0 g dosage, 120 min adsorption time, pH 7-11), following second-order kinetics and Langmuir model, indicating a spontaneous and endothermic process.
population_specificity: Wastewater containing methylene blue dye.
effective_dosage: 1.0 g of Mg@FA per 150 mg/L methylene blue solution.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between serum magnesium levels and the incidence of bone fragility fractures and vascular calcifications in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Lower serum magnesium levels (<2.2 mg/dL) were significantly associated with a higher incidence of bone fragility fractures and more vascular calcifications in hemodialysis patients. Patients with magnesium levels below this threshold had a 1.32-fold increased risk of fractures.
population_specificity: Prevalent hemodialysis patients (mean age 68.3 years, 59% male).
effective_dosage: Not specified (serum levels <2.2 mg/dL were used as a threshold).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of magnesium sulfate versus nifedipine in treating preterm birth.
results_summary: Magnesium sulfate was less effective than nifedipine in prolonging pregnancy and had a slower onset of action. It was also associated with more maternal side effects and higher incidence of neonatal respiratory distress syndrome.
population_specificity: Pregnant women at risk of preterm birth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore magnesium's potential as a prebiotic for oral microbiome modification and its antibacterial properties in dental caries prevention.
results_summary: Magnesium may function as a prebiotic by promoting commensal streptococci colonization and has antibacterial effects by disrupting bacterial cell membranes. Nanoparticles like magnesium oxide show promise as fillers in dental composites for caries prevention.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human health and oral microbiome context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize and characterize a new magnesium phthalocyanine compound and evaluate its biological activities, including antioxidant, antidiabetic, antimicrobial, and DNA cleavage effects.
results_summary: The study found that the magnesium phthalocyanine compound (4) exhibited excellent antioxidant (75.71%) and antidiabetic (81.83%) activities, strong antimicrobial effects, and DNA cleavage ability, with 100% microbial cell viability inhibition at 100 mg/L.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if dietary potassium magnesium sulphate (PMS) supplementation could mitigate transport stress and improve meat quality in finishing pigs.
results_summary: PMS supplementation reduced stress markers (norepinephrine, cortisol) and improved antioxidant activity (GSH-Px, CAT, T-AOC), while also enhancing meat quality by reducing drip loss and improving intestinal health in transported pigs.
population_specificity: Finishing pigs (68.00 ± 0.40 kg initial weight).
effective_dosage: 0.50% PMS added to the basal diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antidepressant efficacy of a novel imipramine-magnesium (IMI-Mg) complex compared to individual administration of imipramine and magnesium.
results_summary: The IMI-Mg complex reduced immobility time in behavioral tests (FST and TST), indicating antidepressant-like effects comparable to separate administration of imipramine and magnesium. The study also noted potential benefits in oxidative stress markers under acute environmental stress.
population_specificity: Adult male albino Swiss mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a DCPD/MgF2 Janus membrane made from Magnesium alloys for guided bone regeneration, focusing on osteogenesis and soft tissue healing.
results_summary: The DCPD/MgF2 Janus membrane demonstrated suitable degradability, selective osteogenic properties, and soft tissue healing in vitro and in vivo, promoting bone formation and space maintenance. RNA-seq analysis indicated specific cellular responses to the different coatings.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo study, likely animal models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Magnesium Sulfate spray versus Lidocaine spray in controlling hemodynamic changes after laryngoscopy and tracheal intubation.
results_summary: Magnesium Sulfate spray significantly reduced systolic blood pressure at 3, 5, and 7 minutes post-intubation compared to Lidocaine, though it may be associated with tachycardia. Other hemodynamic variables showed no significant differences between the two groups.
population_specificity: 100 patients aged 18-40, classified as ASA I or II, undergoing elective surgery in Karaj.
study_duration: Measurements taken before intubation and at 1, 3, 5, 7, and 10 minutes post-intubation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether taking magnesium supplementation with meals versus while fasting had a differential impact on urinary biochemistry in patients with a history of calcium oxalate stones and isolated hyperoxaluria.
results_summary: Patients taking magnesium with meals showed greater improvements in urinary oxalate reduction, magnesium increase, and citrate increase compared to those taking it while fasting. The study suggests that magnesium supplementation is more effective when taken with meals for preventing recurrent calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis.
population_specificity: Patients with a history of calcium oxalate stones and isolated hyperoxaluria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a combination treatment (psyllium, magnesium sulphate, and paraffin oil) in clearing intestinal sand accumulation in horses diagnosed with sand enteropathy.
results_summary: The treatment was successful in clearing intestinal sand in 81% of equids, with a median duration of 4 days. Miniature Ponies had a lower success rate (44%), and complications were common (30%) but generally mild or self-limiting.
population_specificity: Horses and donkeys diagnosed with sand enteropathy (52 horses and 2 donkeys).
effective_dosage: Magnesium sulphate at 1 g/kg daily via nasogastric intubation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the local and systemic tissue responses to degrading ultrahigh-purity ZX00 (Mg-Zn-Ca alloy) and ultrahigh-purity Mg (XHP-Mg) pins in juvenile rats, comparing them to titanium implants and controls.
results_summary: Degradation products of ZX00 and XHP-Mg pins promoted osteogenesis via Bmp2 and Opg upregulation, enhanced hydroxyapatite/collagen alignment, and stimulated glycogenolysis in the liver, with XHP-Mg showing a faster degradation rate and distinct gene/metabolite effects.
population_specificity: Juvenile healthy rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of intra-articular magnesium supplementation for osteoarthritis using a novel nanoparticle delivery system to prolong magnesium release.
results_summary: The study found that MgO@SiO2 nanocapsules extended magnesium release to over 72 hours, significantly mitigated OA progression in rabbits, and reduced inflammation by inhibiting the NF-κB/p65 pathway without systemic toxicity.
population_specificity: Rabbit osteoarthritis model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of magnesium supplementation on serum levels of total cholesterol, triglycerides, LDL-C, and HDL-C in adults aged ≥18 years.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of magnesium on total cholesterol, triglycerides, or LDL-C levels but observed a significant increase in HDL-C levels. However, high heterogeneity suggests the need for further research.
population_specificity: General population aged ≥18 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining magnesium with nimodipine for managing subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH).
results_summary: The combination of magnesium and nimodipine significantly reduced cerebral vasospasm and delayed cerebral ischemia but did not improve functional outcomes, mortality, or secondary cerebral infarction. Adverse events were higher in the combination group but not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients with subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a process for recycling manganese, magnesium, and ammonium from electrolytic manganese metal industry waste salts (EMMWS).
results_summary: The study found that 92.78% of magnesium in the waste solution could be precipitated as 4MgCO3·Mg(OH)2·4H2O, and 98.81% of residual magnesium could be removed as struvite, with all products meeting national standards.
population_specificity: Industrial waste salts (EMMWS) from the electrolytic manganese metal industry.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel MgFe2O4-Schiff base-chitosan nanocomposite as a nanoadsorbent for removing Pb(II) ions from aqueous media.
results_summary: The nanocomposite demonstrated outstanding adsorption capacity (290.7 mg g-1) for Pb(II) ions, with optimal removal at pH 5.5, 100 min contact time, and 328 K temperature. It also showed excellent recyclability, retaining 94.8% efficiency after five cycles.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on aqueous media).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (nanocomposite used as adsorbent, not consumed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between magnesium (Mg) concentration and diabetic neuropathy (DN) and assess the potential benefits of Mg supplementation for preventing or treating DN.
results_summary: The study found that Mg depletion is linked to neuropathy in diabetic patients and may contribute to DN onset or worsening by promoting axonal degeneration. Mg supplementation showed neuroprotective effects, suggesting potential as an alternative or complementary therapy for DN.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients with or at risk of neuropathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the magnesium depletion score (MDS) is associated with all-cause and cardiovascular disease mortality in individuals with MASLD or MetALD.
results_summary: Higher MDS (>2) was associated with significantly increased all-cause and CVD mortality, particularly in those with inadequate Mg intake or lower fibrosis risk. Correcting Mg deficiency may offer long-term health benefits for high-risk patients.
population_specificity: 3802 participants with MASLD or MetALD from the NHANES III cohort.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal annealing temperature to reduce residual stress and minimize brittle intermetallic formation in roll-bonded aluminum/magnesium laminates.
results_summary: Stress-relief treatment at 200°C/1h effectively reduced residual stress and limited brittle intermetallic formation at the Al/Mg interface, improving laminate integrity. Higher temperatures increased undesirable intermetallic phases.
population_specificity: Aluminum/magnesium laminates (material study, no human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (material processing conditions: 200°C to 400°C annealing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a bioabsorbable magnesium-based bulk metallic glass composite (Mg67Zn28Ca5 BMGC) enriched with molybdenum particles for improving outcomes in medial opening wedge high tibial osteotomy (MOWHTO) surgeries.
results_summary: The Mg67Zn28Ca5 BMGC demonstrated mechanical properties closely matching human cortical bone, controlled degradation, superior cellular responses, and successful bone integration in vivo. Finite element analysis confirmed its mechanical effectiveness in MOWHTO, suggesting potential for improved surgical outcomes.
population_specificity: Animal model (in vivo) and human MOWHTO (finite element analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how magnesium ions regulate the glycolytic pathway to enhance the differentiation of enteric neural crest cells (ENCCs) into neurons.
results_summary: Magnesium ions increased glycolysis levels during ENCCs differentiation, upregulated neuronal markers, and enhanced functional neuronal properties. The GelMA-ALMA hydrogel effectively delivered magnesium ions locally, promoting neuronal differentiation without systemic hypermagnesemia.
population_specificity: Enteric neural crest cells (ENCCs) in vitro and in vivo (transplanted into renal capsule and subcutaneously).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium levels were associated with changes in impulsivity during ketamine treatment in patients with mood disorders.
results_summary: The study found no association between magnesium concentration and impulsivity, as measured by the BIS-11, during ketamine treatment. Magnesium did not demonstrate a significant effect on impulsivity in this context.
population_specificity: Forty-nine inpatients with treatment-resistant mood disorders (major depressive disorder and bipolar disorder).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining sodium tungstate impregnation and silane treatment could enhance the corrosion resistance of a magnesium alloy microarc oxidation (MAO) coating.
results_summary: The study found that the M-nW-SG composite coating (sodium tungstate impregnation followed by silane treatment) significantly improved corrosion resistance compared to untreated or partially treated coatings. The best performance was observed at a sodium tungstate concentration of 0.125 mol/L, with impedance modulus values three orders of magnitude higher than other coatings after 144 hours in a NaCl solution.
population_specificity: Magnesium alloy microarc oxidation (MAO) coatings (in vitro study, no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Sodium tungstate impregnation concentrations tested (0.1 mol/L and above, with 0.125 mol/L being optimal).
study_duration: Coating performance assessed after 144 hours in a 3.5 wt.% NaCl solution.

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of oral magnesium chloride plus vitamin D in alleviating depressive symptoms related to long-COVID in individuals with hypomagnesemia and vitamin D deficiency.
results_summary: Combined magnesium and vitamin D supplementation significantly reduced depressive symptoms (BDI <11) in 73.2% of the intervention group compared to 34.5% in the control group. The intervention was safe, with mild adverse events reported in 20% of the intervention group and 10% of the control group.
population_specificity: 60 individuals with long-COVID, hypomagnesemia, vitamin D deficiency, and mild-to-moderate depression (aged 52.8±12.6 years).
effective_dosage: 1300 mg magnesium chloride plus 4000 IU vitamin D daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of using corn carbon and non-dynamic magnesium metal self-corrosion for phosphate recovery from swine wastewater.
results_summary: The study found that under optimal conditions (7h reaction time, 5:1 C:Mg mass ratio, 800 rpm stirring, 0.48 m3/L·h aeration), phosphate recovery reached 95.61%, with the precipitate identified as high-quality struvite.
population_specificity: Swine wastewater
effective_dosage: Mass ratio of corn carbon to magnesium plate was 5:1

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how omeprazole affects urinary magnesium excretion and fractional excretion of magnesium in children with peptic disease.
results_summary: The study found that omeprazole treatment significantly reduced urinary and serum magnesium levels, as well as fractional excretion of magnesium, suggesting renal conservation of magnesium rather than increased urinary loss. Serum creatinine levels showed a slight increase, while urinary creatinine levels rose significantly.
population_specificity: 44 children diagnosed with acid peptic disease at the Gastroenterology Clinic of Imam Hossein Hospital, Isfahan, Iran.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of serum magnesium levels on hospitalization and 28-day mortality in geriatric patients over 70 years old.
results_summary: Hypermagnesemia was associated with higher hospitalization rates and 28-day mortality, while hypomagnesemia was more manageable. Magnesium levels significantly differed between deceased patients and survivors.
population_specificity: Geriatric patients aged over 70 presenting to the emergency department for non-trauma complaints.
effective_dosage: Not specified (serum levels assessed: hypomagnesemia ≤1.7 mg/dL, normomagnesemia 1.7-2.2 mg/dL, hypermagnesemia ≥2.2 mg/dL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relationship between serum Magnesium (Mg²⁺) levels and the development of Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN) in STEMI patients undergoing primary percutaneous coronary intervention (pPCI).
results_summary: The study found that lower Mg²⁺ levels (<2.03 mg/dL) were significantly associated with a higher incidence of CIN, with an AUC of 0.711, sensitivity of 69%, and specificity of 68%. Multivariate analysis confirmed Mg²⁺ deficiency as an independent risk factor for CIN.
population_specificity: 2306 consecutive STEMI patients undergoing pPCI.
effective_dosage: Not specified (serum levels measured, not administered).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining magnesium and strontium with bioactive glass (BGMSN) enhances osteogenic and antibacterial properties for bone regeneration, particularly in infected conditions.
results_summary: BGMSN demonstrated excellent biocompatibility, upregulated osteogenic genes, and exhibited potent antibacterial effects against common pathogens. Animal experiments confirmed its exceptional bone-inducing ability.
population_specificity: In vitro cell studies (MC3T3-E1) and animal models (specifics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium supplementation reduces mortality rates in patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF).
results_summary: Magnesium supplementation significantly reduced 28-day all-cause mortality, particularly in older patients, females, and those with hypertension or without diabetes. However, it also led to longer ICU and hospital stays.
population_specificity: HFpEF patients from the MIMIC-IV database (2008-2019), with 985 patients in each group after propensity score matching.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium sulfate could enhance the effectiveness and prolong the therapeutic duration of epidural steroid injections for chronic radicular pain.
results_summary: Magnesium significantly reduced pain intensity, disability, and analgesic consumption over a 6-month period, outperforming both the control and dexmedetomidine groups by the end of the study.
population_specificity: 90 patients with unilateral lower limb radiculopathy due to lumbar disc prolapse unresponsive to conservative treatment for 12 weeks.
effective_dosage: 200 mg magnesium sulfate (single dose, epidural injection).
study_duration: Single intervention with follow-up assessments at 1 week, 1, 3, and 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how tartaric acid enhances the hydroxyapatite coating on AZ31 Mg alloy to improve corrosion resistance and biological activity.
results_summary: Tartaric acid significantly improved corrosion resistance in both post-treatment and direct addition methods, with the post-treatment sample showing the highest bio-corrosion resistance and least morphological changes after 3 weeks in SBF solution. The post-treatment method also provided better antibacterial properties compared to other coatings.
population_specificity: AZ31 Mg alloy substrate (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 1 g/L tartaric acid, immersion times of 2 min (post-treatment) and 2 h (direct addition)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the plasma magnesium levels and bioavailability of a magnesium-based nutraceutical ingredient (MAGSHAPE) compared to other magnesium sources in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: The study found that MAGSHAPE significantly increased plasma magnesium levels at all tested time points (1, 4, and 6 hours) and demonstrated superior bioavailability compared to non-microencapsulated magnesium oxide (MgO). It also reduced common adverse effects like intestinal motility and gastric heaviness.
population_specificity: 40 healthy women and men
study_duration: 7 days (low-Mg diet) with measurements taken up to 6 hours post-administration

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate supplement utilization and dietary behaviors, including Magnesium, in adults with acquired brain injury (ABI).
results_summary: The study found that 55% of participants increased supplement use after ABI, with 74% consuming supplements, but specific effects of Magnesium were not detailed.
population_specificity: Adults with acquired brain injury (ABI) presenting to outpatient brain injury clinics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between magnesium status and cardiovascular disease, including potential mechanisms and public health implications.
results_summary: The study found an inverse relationship between magnesium intake/serum levels and cardiovascular disease, with deficiencies linked to hypertension, stroke, heart failure, and other conditions. Magnesium supplementation was shown to mitigate physiological and metabolic changes caused by deficiency.
population_specificity: General population, particularly those with inadequate magnesium intake (e.g., individuals not consuming recommended whole grains, pulses, or green vegetables).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential association between magnesium (Mg) and neurodegenerative disorders (AD, PD, ALS) and assess its neuroprotective properties.
results_summary: The review found that Mg exhibits neuroprotective, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and mitochondrial-supportive properties, suggesting potential therapeutic benefits for AD, PD, and ALS. However, more standardized studies and clinical trials are needed to confirm its exact role and optimal dosages.
population_specificity: Subjects with Alzheimer's disease (AD), Parkinson's disease (PD), and Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), as well as animal models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of magnesium sulfate therapy in improving short-term mortality and morbidities in neonates with post-asphyxial encephalopathy.
results_summary: The majority of trials (60%) focusing on magnesium sulfate therapy showed significant improvements in short-term mortality and morbidities, though evidence on long-term outcomes was limited.
population_specificity: Term infants post-asphyxia in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal dose and duration of magnesium supplementation for reducing systolic blood pressure in the general population.
results_summary: Magnesium supplementation at dosages ≤360 mg/day and durations >3 months reduced systolic blood pressure by -3.03 and -4.31 mm Hg, respectively, demonstrating greater efficacy at lower dosages and longer durations.
population_specificity: General normotensive population

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of magnesium, potassium, and their combination on cholesterol levels and quality of life in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: Magnesium supplementation led to a significant improvement in social quality of life and contributed to a decrease in cholesterol levels, though the largest reduction was observed with potassium. The combined effect of magnesium and potassium was beneficial for hyperlipidaemia in T2DM patients.
population_specificity: 290 patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the role of magnesium in skeletal muscle health, particularly its biological effects and clinical implications in neuromuscular diseases (NMDs).
results_summary: Preclinical studies showed magnesium modulates skeletal muscle homeostasis and oxidative stress, while clinical studies demonstrated magnesium supplementation improves muscle mass, respiratory strength, exercise recovery, and reduces soreness and inflammation. However, research on magnesium supplementation in NMDs remains limited.
population_specificity: Athletes, patients with various conditions, and neuromuscular disease (NMD) patients (though limited data available for NMDs).

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the use of alkali supplementation, including magnesium bicarbonate or citrate, for treating distal renal tubular acidosis (dRTA).
results_summary: The abstract mentions that alkali supplementation (including magnesium) is used to correct acid-base imbalance in dRTA, but no specific results regarding magnesium's effects are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with distal renal tubular acidosis (dRTA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether continuous intravenous magnesium sulphate administration in the perioperative period could prevent postoperative atrial fibrillation (POAF) compared to placebo in cardiac surgery patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as the study is ongoing and no outcomes are reported yet.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery, stratified by the presence of valvular surgery.
effective_dosage: Ionized magnesium levels targeted between 1.5 and 2.0 mmol/L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether magnesium sulfate supplementation could reduce postoperative pain and opioid consumption.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium sulfate supplementation was effective in decreasing postoperative pain and opioid use, suggesting a beneficial role in pain management.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgery (specific type not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a supplement containing magnesium, probiotics, and prebiotics on glycemic control and serum triglycerides in individuals with DMT-1.
results_summary: The study found that the supplement significantly improved serum triglycerides in well-controlled individuals with DMT-1, but no specific results regarding magnesium's isolated effects were reported.
population_specificity: 61 individuals with DMT-1 (mean age 48.3 ± 14.6 years, 42.6% female).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether optimal serum magnesium levels enhance remission rates in Crohn's disease and assess the potential benefits of magnesium supplementation in its management.
results_summary: The study found significantly lower serum magnesium levels in Crohn's disease patients compared to controls, with hypomagnesemia prevalent in up to 50% of patients. Lower magnesium levels correlated with increased sleep latency, and men with Crohn's disease exhibited notably lower magnesium intake.
population_specificity: Crohn's disease patients (453 patients and 292 controls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effects of magnesium supplementation (MgS) on muscle soreness in physically active individuals, focusing exclusively on MgS without co-administration of other substances.
results_summary: The study found that MgS reduced muscle soreness, improved performance and recovery, and had a protective effect on muscle damage. The positive effects were observed when magnesium intake was 10-20% higher than sedentary requirements, taken in capsules 2 hours before training.
population_specificity: Physically active individuals and sport specialists.
effective_dosage: 10-20% higher than sedentary requirements, in capsules 2 hours before training.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the mechanisms of magnesium absorption, regulation, and disorders, as well as explore potential treatments for hypomagnesemia.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium is crucial for numerous enzymatic reactions and is tightly regulated in the body through intestinal and renal pathways.
